    Forest P. Hayes

    Forest is an ecologist and postdoctoral fellow at Colorado State University in the Colorado Cooperative Fish and Wildlife Research Unit and Department of Fish, Wildlife, and Conservation Biology.

    Research:

    Forest studies wildlife, climate, and the impacts of human activity with an emphasis on (1) ecology and conservation of imperiled populations, (2) behavioral responses to disturbance and capacity for adaptation, and (3) development and application of innovative technologies to address otherwise intractable problems. Read more about Forest’s research.
